title: Grateful Dead Live at Hampton Coliseum on 1981-05-01
lineage: Master FOB Audience Cassette > Sennheiser 421 mics> Sony D5 cassette deck > DAT > CDR
description: Alabama Getaway-> Promised Land, Friend Of The Devil-> Me & My Uncle-> Big River, Althea-> Little Red Rooster, Tennessee Jed-> Let It Grow-> Deal Feel Like A Stranger-> Franklin's Tower-> Lost Sailor-> Saint Of Circumstance-> He's Gone-> The Other One-> Drums-> The Wheel-> Wharf Rat-> Sugar Magnolia, E: U.S. Blues

reviews.review_text:
Got it?  Get it. First off, this recording is the best I've heard of a Dead show.  Nice atmosphere, you can hear the crowd responses, and yet the music is right up front, crystal clear, well-balanced, and with a very full presence.  This sounds like a matrix- it's that good.  It's a more fun listen than the Betty Boards of the 70's or the later Matrix recordings from Healy.
The other thing about this show is that Jerry is torching the Hampton Coliseum on this particular night.  It takes exceptional playing to get me to listen to a first set more than once, and I love this one.  All around great show.  If you are interested enough to be reading this review, then you need this show.  Get it.
Wow! I'm a bonafide "soundboard snob", but my, oh my, this is a FINE audience recoding... best I've heard.  Well done!

Wow, indeed! To say Jerry was "on" this night would be a very big understatement.  He positively wails: listen to Althea, or Let it Grow-> Deal.  An amazing audience recording and an amazing show.  I too am particularly partial to the first set.
Stranger>Franklins This is the Enegizer Bunny of Franklins..........It just keeps goin and goin and goin

The first set is what the Dead is all about...IMO! I can't explain it but there's something magical about the first set. Don't know what it is but I haven't heard a show as full of life as this one...a real rare gem...someone get this released on Dick's Picks before this archive disappears...this is Dead that needs to be heard.
BTW...Jerry's rippin' it up...my favs are Tennessee Jed and Let it Grow; one of the most organic versions this side of the Mississippi.
Download and share with your non-head friends.
"Deal" will suck them in...I swear it.
Good God! First set is on fire.  One of the best Let it Grows.  Jerry can't stop flying.  Get it.

Good Show I attended this show. The fair or something was going on right next to the place. What a blast. We waited in line for 2 hours before being let in and walking to the stage wall.

This is the first time I have heard the Franklins, which I seem to remember freakin me out. Now I know why.

Other than the Lost Sailor>St of Circumstance beatdown(if you were seeing a lot of shows at this time, you know what I mean), a fine effort. Made all the better by festival seating, which we didnt see too often on the East Coast. 

Quite frankly, we had to see a lot of shows to find the gems like this. Not that is wasnt fun, but these types of shows are what kept me going to so many shows.
Whoa! lightening quick pace to this show....jerry is rockin for sure...good sound for that time period too.  must download this one...you'll see why jerry loved that white stuff so much :)

One of the best GD Aud Sources Amazing audience source tapes.  Thank God the performance measured up...very energetic readings of every tune. 

4.5 really, 4 star performance, 5 star audience quality

Great AUD! This AUD is amazing...you really feel like you're there.  And the boys showed up with their A game...playing is fantastic, full of energy.  Very up tempo show...Jerry is on fire!  Get it now!

to get the soundboards OK TO ALL !!! ALL YOU HAVE TO GET THESE SOUNDBOARDS IS HOOK UP YOUR RADIO/TAPE DECK TO YOUR COMPUTER AND RECORD THE SHOW WHILE ITS PLAYING !!ALL YOU NEED TO DO THIS IS A MIC TO AUDIO CABLE OR A HEADPHONE TO AUDIO CABLE. EASY AS CAN BE !! THEN YOU CAN GET A PROGRAM TO RECORD THE PLAYBACK OF THE TAPE THROUGH YOUR MIC INPUT ON YOUR COMPUTER AND THEN YOU CAN SPLIT THE SONGS YOURSELF AND THEN BURN THEM TO A CD!! HAHA I SUGGEST SOUND FORGE 7.0 OR LOWER TO DO THIS, IF YOU NEED THE PROGRAM CONTACT ME AND I'LL GET IT TO YOU !!! 

GRATEFULDEAD2777@SBCGLOBAL.NET

THIS IS STILL BETTER THAN THE OLD DAYS WHEN YOU COULDN'T EVEN FIND TAPERS OR ANYONE WITH TAPES, SPREAD THE WORD !!! SEEMS TO ME THAT PEOPLE ARE GETTING A LITTLE SPOILED AROUND HERE, FORGOTTON ABOUT THERE ROOTS !!!

sndbrds as streams streams are not any where near the fidelity of a downloaded shorten file.....it is essentially an mp3 file........if your goal in obtaining the soundboard is ultimate fidelity, taping a stream is a waste of time.......snail mail trading is the only way to access those sbds if you are like me and refuse to pay the exhorbitant prices for gd store downloads even if they happen to release the show you are interested in.......this however is an excellent show to download as the aud recording is excellent

Outstanding AUD tape & show This is a must DL for anyone bummed about the recent loss of SBD's...in many ways superior to the SBD that used to be available for DL...mostly b/c you need to hear the crowd reacting to Garcia's insane guitar licks on LET IT GROW>DEAL, BIG RIVER, and the killer push by Phil at the end of ALTHEA (one of the best ever), and just about anything in the First Set. Jerry just wails on every tune in Set 1 and 2 is no slouch either.

The Dead loved Hampton; you'll love this show.

Nice recording I agree that this is an excellent recording made on a D5, which is no surprise because many of the best audience tapes recorded were made on Sony D5s, the old gold standard for portable cassette decks. This tape is a great example of that quality, and the crowd factor that can't be heard on soundboards is nice to have. The overall balance of this recording is A+, however the vocals sounded slightly brassy and enhanced to my ears.

All that aside, a great show from 81 and a worthy recording to take the place of the SB download that isn't here...:-P

Somebody forgot to tell Jerry this was not a JGB show That is all I am thinking right now- tasty first set- and the tempos and Jerry's playing- like ALthea, sound like a JGB show.

ANyone else agree?
OMG did you forget this show? One of the best shows I've ever seen, Rooster might be the best they ever did and the 1st set is outstanding. if you don't move to this you can't be Dead

Appreciation I appreciate the discussion of trading and getting SBD's and all, but this discussion is supposed to be about an outstanding AUD recording.

I am going by the reviews and downloading it now.  I will come back and revise my five-star review if there is anything disappointing about this... judging from the number of reviews, though, I doubt I will have to come back.

real nice 81 aud recording very live sounding. very spatial.
I love the Me & uncle>Big River Althea and  Stranger>Franklins>Lost>Saint. Brents doing some killer stuff on Stranger all over the place so sick Jerry leads im the jam are so insane. This is Prime Jerry Garcia and The Boys are smokin right along with him. This single night at Hampton was such a hot night of Dead history. Some of The Dead at their finest. i love how Jerry sounds singing in 1981. My favorite shows of '81 would be the Greek run. The epitomy of the Dead, I mean those recordings are something to be treasured in my book. Holy Grail level- this show rocks too and so does Long Beach.

Good Sound, Great Energy they come out busting like they had something to prove to the world. jerry's licks get oh so mellow in althea (how can this sound like a JGB show when JGB never played althea?). 

highly rec'd on the sound (incredible FOB)and the 85'- like energy.

Who needs SB's? I guess my memory of AUD tapes was those that sounded like they were recorded from the fouth stall of the men's room.  I became a SB snob.  I finally installed a nice HI_FI system in my living room, and there is nothing like a sweet AUD to bring you back.  There are nights when the Dead are in my living room.  Get this show!

Seriously doubt this is an AUD I think this is a Pre-FM recording.  Even better!  This is how you want all of the shows to sound like - you can hear the band perfectly, and also hear the crowd get up for songs.
Pre-FM doesn't necessarily mean SBD You'd be surprised how many FMs were broadcast from Healy's mikes, not the board.  6/21/84 and 12/31/83 are just two examples.
next night might be better The next night at the spectrum is pretty tasty too! Everything after space is great...O1 brings back the ultra heady mind altering classic dead vibe
A Great Hampton Show This is a great one--Ol' Jer definitely brought his "A" game for this show.
althea good mellow show

mellow? huh? This show is 'mellow'? Listen again to the "Let it Grow" and the "Deal". Garcia is wide awake and in full shred mode. Sound is absolutely fantastic. 

The segment spanning "He's Gone" and "Other One" is surprisingly cursory. Like they finally ran out of steam. Great, great show though. I am back for repeat listens.
good Franklin's The Wheel in 1981 is prime.

Magic You know how sometimes the band transcends the music and goes from music to magic ....... That's what this whole f'n show was.... If I were there and that was the first time I ever heard them I'd of spent the rest of my life just trying to get a ticket for every show....

1st set 5 stars This is the first set of all 1st sets as far as ENERGY.  Wow every comment is on mark too, the one about JGB band I can kind of see where he is coming from. Only I might be the opposite of what he is thinking dam does Jerry jam this first set. During Rooster he throws a little popping lead at 1:30 mark. As far as Let It Grow at the 4 minute mark Jerry is fanning the fire something intense. 
 Just starting 2nd set now, although have heard this 2nd set many times every times different.
 For those of you/us who are sober here they say every time you read the Big Book something new jumps out at you.  Same thing here with this show.

Second Set Magic This second set is magic.  The sudden transition from He's Gone to The Other One is something out of Beethoven (think his 6th 'pastoral' symphony... the transition away from the "merry gathering of country folk" of the third movement into the sturm und drang of the fourth movement: literally the "Thunder Storm."  The Grateful Dead of the first half of the second set are gone in a flash of guitars and drums and the other ones have arrived!  Then, in true 6th Symphony fashion, there are "the happy and thankful feelings after the storm." A joyous Sugar Mag to cap off the symphonic second set.  

I know I know... I may have taken this analogy a bit far but something about the way this second set played out has all the emotion and drama of that early 19th century Beethoven.  Oh well.

Otherwise this is a great AUD with a fantastic mix.  Play it loud.
Let it Grow Best 80's version of Let it Grow
Oh what a night Family print + Fast Eddie + carnival in the lot next door + an electric vibe not very felt in those days from the audience + Jerry really feeling it = great fucking show.
Beethoven's 6th Love what was said about that. There is energy here. Love the aud sound. Even with old ears that don't love high pitched sounds and don't usually love 80's shows, it sounds great.

WHAT MEMORIES The night before this show I was getting ready to go to sleep.  My phone rings and it's my dear friend Alan (R.I.P.) and he's telling me he has 2 chicks planning to drive down to Virginia to see the Grateful Dead and there are 2 seats available for us to ride down with them.  Well, that sure changed my plans.  What a perfect show to end up going to.  We had floor seats and I remember distinctly how the boys came right out like they were shot out of a cannon.  The sound was perfect and right away they were on fire with the opening ALABAMA > PROMISED LAND.  It just got better and better with a first set for the ages.  Everything was stellar and, IMHO, ROOSTER , LET IT GROW and DEAL were beyond stellar.  The second set was only GREAT with a wonderful STRANGER > FRANKLIN'S opener.  I will never forget this night.  And yes, this recording captures the greatness very well.

An experience that I will never forget! This was one of the 85 Dead shows I experienced in my "career". I was also at the Alpine Valley show. I started following them in 1978, my first year in college. Once I experienced my first show, I would do what was necessary to see as many shows as I could when they were on the Eastern side of the country. Had to attend college an extra year to make up for the time I was "absent". Althea is one of my favorite Dead songs, and I have always thought this was one of the best versions of the song as well. I saw was also fortunate to see Chris Robinson with Phil and Friends cover it as well. Their version is also one of the best I have ever seen as well.
